title: 114_s1249
content: The Act may be cited as the "Military Families Credit Reporting Act" and includes a provision for notice of status as an active duty military consumer. The Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to include a provision for active duty military consumers to provide proof of their status for any adverse information on their consumer report. The Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to include a provision for active duty military consumers to easily notify consumer reporting agencies of their status through a model form provided by the Bureau. The Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to include provisions for active duty military consumers, such as notifying consumer reporting agencies of adverse information received and providing a model form for easy notification. The Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to include provisions for active duty military consumers, such as notifying consumer reporting agencies of adverse information received and providing a model form for easy notification. Contact information for active duty military consumers must be used for all communications while they are on active duty. Congress believes that anyone using a consumer report with adverse information should take appropriate action. The Fair Credit Reporting Act is amended to include provisions for active duty military consumers, such as notifying consumer reporting agencies of adverse information received and providing a model form for easy notification. Contact information for active duty military consumers must be used for all communications while they are on active duty. Congress believes that anyone using a consumer report with adverse information should take appropriate action, including considering the consumer's active duty status when evaluating creditworthiness. The Fair Credit Reporting Act now requires consumer reporting agencies to include and indicate in consumer reports that the individual was an active duty military consumer at the time of the disputed item.
